title: Treasure Island
therenow: 800 apartments, Job Corps campus run by the U.S. Department of Labor.
planned: Up to 8,000 housing units, 25 percent affordable, a 500-room hotel and 550,000 square feet of retail and offices. Plus a new ferry terminal, perhaps with "Star Wars" creator George Lucas' proposed museum next door.
protective: New soil will be pounded into the island to strengthen it during an earthquake and raise the surface several feet. New buildings will be set back at least 300 feet from the shoreline.
timetable: Site work already is under way at Yerba Buena Island, also part of the project. Treasure Island's groundwork could begin next year.

title: Mission Rock
therenow: A surface parking lot for AT&T Park.
planned: 1,500 housing units, 40 percent of them affordable, plus office buildings and a waterfront park. The project also includes Pier 48, which would be rehabbed for Anchor Brewing's new home.
protective: The central blocks would be set four feet above current levels and reached by sloped roadways on the east, west and south.
timetable: The draft environmental impact report should be released by year's end. Voters already have endorsed plans to allow three buildings as tall as 240 feet.

title: Pier 70
planned: Mixed-use buildings topping off at 90 feet and clustered around a central plaza, set 100 feet from the current shore. Thirty percent of housing will be affordable.
protective: Shoreline would climb to a new height above 2100 sea-level-rise projections. Three historic buildings now in harm's way would be elevated or moved.
timetable: Developer Forest City is aiming for approvals next summer.

title: Candlestick Point
therenow: Everything from the ghost of Candlestick Park and remnants of Hunters Point Naval Shipyard to a hillside where roughly 200 condominiums have been built.
planned: The approved plan allows 12,000 housing units — one-third of them affordable — 6 million square feet of commercial and retail space, and 350 acres of parks. Public benefits would include $50 million for Candlestick Point State Recreation Area.
protective: Extensive waterfront open space would connect the Hunters Point neighborhood to the bay and include marshes to help soften the impact of rising tides.
timetable: The 775-acre project's master plan was approved in 2010, and the first hillside condominiums opened last year. At the former Candlestick Park, a regional shopping center should open in fall 2019.
